II. It appears that he wrote this Epistle before he came into Macedonia, from what he saith in the Second Epistle, chap. ii. 12, 13, and vii. 5—7. For when he met not Titus at Troas, whom together with Stephanas‚ Fortunatus, and Achaicus, he had sent to Corinth with this Epistle, 1101· as yet could know what fruit it had gained among the Corinth- ians, he hastened a journey into Macedonia. And when he came thither and found not Titus there, he stayed for some time with an unquiet mind, until Titus at last came, the mes- senger of good news.
